Agent Brown, however, has the same unnatural grace. The METAL SCREAM of an EL TRAIN is heard and Trinity turns to it, racing for the back of the building. The edge falls away into a wide back alley.  The next building is over 40 feet away, but Trinity's face is perfectly calm, staring at some point beyond the other roof. The cops slow, realizing they are about to see something ugly as Trinity drives at the edge, launching herself into the air. From above, the ground seems to flow beneath her as she hangs in flight Then hitting, somersaulting up, still running hard.

direction.raw_text: They stare, slack-jawed, as Agent Brown duplicates the move exactly, landing, rolling over a shoulder, up onto one knee. Just below the building are the runbling tracks of riveted steel.  The TRAIN SCREECHES beneath her, a rattling blur of gray metal.  Trinity junps, landing easily. She looks back just as Agent Brown hurls through the air barely reaching the last car Agent Brown stands, yanking out a gun. Trinity is running hard as BULLETS WHISTLE past her head. Ahead she sees her only chance, 50 feet beyond the point where the train has begun to turn, there is -- A window; a yellow glow in the midst of a dark brick building. Trinity zeroes in on it, running as hard as she can, her speed compounded by the train.  The SCREAM of the STEEL rises as she nears the edge where the train rocks into the turn. Trinity hurtles into the empty night space, her body leveling into a dive.  She falls, arms covering her head as -- The whole world seems to spin on its axis -- And she crashes with an EXPLOSION of GLASS and WOOD, then falls onto a back stairwell, tumbling, bouncing down stairs bleeding, broken -- But still alive. Through the smashed window, she glimpses Agent Brown, still on the train, his tie and coat whipping in the wind; stone-faced, he touches his ear piece as the train slides him past the window. Trinity tries to move.  Everything hurts.

Across the street, a garbage truck suddenly u-turns, its TIRES SCREAMING as it accelerates. Trinity sees the headlights on the truck arcing at the telephone booth as if taking aim. Gritting through the pain, she races the truck -- Slamming into the booth, the headlights blindingly bright, bearing down on the box of Plexiglas just as -- She answers the phone. There is a frozen instant of silence before the hulking mass of dark metal lurches up onto the sidewalk -- Barreling through the booth, bulldozing it into a brick wall, smashing it to Plexiglas pulp. After a moment, a black loafer steps down from the cab of the garbage truck.  Agent Smith inspects the wreckage. There is no body.  Trinity is gone. dialogue.raw_text: It seems that you have been living two lives.  In one life, you are Thomas A. Anderson, program writer for a respectable software company.  You have a social security number, you pay your taxes and you help your land lady carry out her garbage.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The other life is lived in computers where you go by the hacker alias Neo, and are guilty of virtually every computer crime we have a law for, including the unauthorized use of the D.M.V. system for the removal of automobile boots.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: One of these,lives has a future. One of them does not.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I'm going to be as forthcoming as I can be, Mr. Anderson.  You are here because we need your help.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We know that you have been contacted by a certain individual. A man who calls himself Morpheus. Whatever you think you know about this man is irrelevant to the fact that he is wanted for acts of terrorism in more countries than any other man in the world.  He is considered by many authorities to be the most dangerous man alive.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: My colleagues believe that I am wasting my time with you, but I believe you want to do the right thing.  It is obvious that you are an intelligent man, Mr. Anderson, and that you are interested in the future.  That is why I believe you are ready to put your past mistakes behind you and get on with your life.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We are willing to wipe the slate clean, to give you a fresh start and all we are asking in return is your cooperation in bringing a known terrorist to justice.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yeah.  Wow.  That sounds like a real good deal.  But I think I have a better one.  How about I give you the finger --
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And you can cram that file up your Secret Service sphincter.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The irony of your situation is that you have no choice.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You can't scare me with this gestapo crap.  I know my rights. I want my phone call.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And tell me, Mr. Anderson, what good is a phone call iy you are unable to speak?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You are going to help us, Mr. Anderson, whether you want to or not.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Screaming, Neo bolts upright in bed. He realizes that he is home.  Was it a dream?  His mouth is normal.  His stomach looks fine.  He starts to take a deep, everything-is-okay breath, when -- The PHONE RINGS. It almost stops his heart.  It CONTINUES RINGING, building pressure in the room, forcing him up out of bed, sucking him in with an almost gravitational force. He answers it, saying nothing.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo feels sick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo's throat cracks, dry as the Sahara.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.). This line is tapped, so I must be brief.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The agents -- MORPHEUS (V.O.) They got to you first, but they've underestimated how important you are.  If they knew what I know, you would probably be dead.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I don't know what you are thinking right now but I want you to understand that I will not give up on you until you give up on me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Do you still want to meet?
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  He closes his eyes, unsure of what he has done.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An EL TRAIN RAGES against its metal rails.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is three a.m., and the train carries the usual urban night crawlers.  Neo sits alone, eyes shifting, watching everything nervously. There is a METAL BANG and TRAIN CLATTER fills the car as the door is opened. Neo turns and sees a large man enter.  He is wearing sunglasses and a black leather jacket.  His name is APOC and he walks straight at Neo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo stands just as the door at the opposite end opens and two police officers rush in, drawing their guns. Apoc grabs Neo, muscling him to the nearest exit.  There is no upcoming station. Apoc yanks the emergency brake and the train buckles against its own speed.  The cops are thrown back.  Neo slams against the metal rail. The doors open onto nothing and just when Neo regains his balance, Apoc shoves him backwards -- He flies out from the train, arms windrilling as he falls from, the raised tracks -- Hurtling towards a busy city street when, out of nowhere, a truck races under him and -- He crashes into a large dumpster-bed filled with empty boxes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still shaking his head, Neo realizes he is not alone.  A man named Cabie is aiming a big gun at him.  Trinity is next to him, talking into a cellular phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She hangs up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She tears off a long strip of black duct-tape and reaches for his face.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She seals his eyes shut with the tape.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: We got him.  Call the chop-shop.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Listen to me, Neo.  You have to, trust us.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This has to be done for your protection and ours.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You can't understand right now, but if you're not one of us, you're one of them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A featureless black van glides up to a staircase that curls down from the city's surface. trinity guides the blind Neo down the steps.  The back of the van slaps open, revealing a young, skinny man who looks to be still in his teens, wearing an outfit that is a cross between a surgeon and a telephone repair man. His name is GIZMO and he smiles lewdly at Trinity, exposing his teeth that are wired with weird-looking braces.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo hears the voices around him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hacksaw is a huge man in a leather welder's apron.  He shoulders Neo and hauls him into the van. A moment later the green lights of Lower Wacker curve over the tinted windshield as the van rushes through the underworld.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Va va va voom.  Still the hottest software around.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is really the guy?  The guy that Morpheus thinks -- TRINITY Yeah.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you going to help us or aren't you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hacksaw.  Load up the copper-top and let's get the hell outta here.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The chop-shop is filled with electronic gadgets, wired to meters and monitors.  There are shelves lined with medical supplies and rows of hanging tools, knives, cleavers, and stainless steel clamps. Neo is strapped down to an ambulance cart, listening nervously as Gizmo gets to work.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He pulls up the goggles hanging at his neck and they blink to life with tiny halogen lights and lenses irising to varying levels of magnification.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He inserts acupuncture-like needles into Neo's lower abdomen.  The needles are wired to video monitors. Hacksaw pilots the fiber-optic lens.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On a monitor, we see the bug nestled in among Neols large intestines.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hacksaw loads a hypodermic needle and pumps an anesthetic around Neols navel. Using a device that looks like a miniature speculum, Gizmo inserts a knuckled dental pick.  Typing into a calculator keypad wired to the pick, he automates the tip. On the monitor, we watch it telescope out and the end separate into a tiny hooked, metal claw.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The claw snags hold of the bug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But the bug reacts violently.  Neo screams as it wraps itself around the soft tissue web of intestine.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo writhes in pain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We watch Neo, who can't see what they are talking about.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The instant he hears the word, he knows.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The cry is frozen in his mouth as the paddles hit his chest.  Gizmo wrestles with the bug.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Again, the electricity convulses through him as Gizmo yanks the speculum out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trinity touches Neo, who is just beginning to breathe. She eases the tape off his eyes.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Hanging from the claw pick is the inanimate metal wire- tap.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Okay, first we take a little look under the hood.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're going to feel a little prick.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We think you're bugged.  We can't take you to Morpheus until you're clean.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Hit him with 10 ccs of local.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I don't know.  They've never done that before.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I got it!  Maybe we can stun it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Are you crazy?  That will kill him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It'll work.  Come on, do it or Hacksaw will.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The van stops in a deserted alley behind a forgotten hotel.  The doors open and Trinity helps Neo get out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She nods then climbs out of the van.  Gizmo ogles the tight leather pants.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trinity turns around.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He howls with adolescent laughter as the van pulls away. Trinity turns to Neo.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I just hope the man knows what he's doing.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Goddamn, what I wouldn't give for a copy of that software.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Gizmo, you don't have the hardware to handle this software.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: It is a place of putrefying elegance, a rotting host of urban maggotry. Trinity leads Neo from the stairwell down the hall of the thirteenth floor.  They stop outside room 1313.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo can hear his own heart pounding.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Let me give one piece of advice. Be honest.  He knows more than you can possibly imagine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Across the room, a dark figure stares out the tall windows veiled with decaying lace.  He turns and his smile lights up the room.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He wears a long black coat and his eyes are invisible behind circular mirrored glasses. He strides to Neo and they shake hands.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He nods to Trinity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She bows her head sharply and exits through a door to an adjacent room. They sit across from one another in cracked, burgundy- leather chairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A smile, razor-thin, curls the corner of his lips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Again, that smile that could cut glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo shrugs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He leans forward.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo shakes his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo locks at his eyes but only sees a reflection of himself.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo swallows and nods his head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The LEATHER CREAKS as he leans back.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Outside, the WIND BATTERS a loose PANE of glass.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In Neo's right hand, Morpheus drops a red pill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In his left, a blue pill.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The pills in his open hands are reflected in the glasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo feels the smooth skin of the capsules, with the moisture growing in his palms.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo opens his mouth and swallows the red pill.  The Cheshire smile returns.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He leads Neo into the other room, which is cramped with high-tech equipment, glowing ash-bliie and electric green from the racks of monitors. Trinity, Apoc and Cypher look up as they enter.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cypher saddles up to Morpheus, talking in a hushed tone away from, Neo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo recognizes the large man from the El train.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He and Trinity are working quickly, hardwiring a complex system of monitors, modules and drives.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the center of the room sits a chair.  Near the chair is an old oval dressing mirror that is cracked.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo sits and Trinity begins gently fixing white electrode disks to his head, arns, and the back of his neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo whispers to Trinity.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She nods, placing a set of headphones over his ears. They are wired to an old hotel phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Distantly, through the ear phones, he hears Apoc POUNDING on a KEYBOARD.  Sweat beads his face.  His eyes blink and twitch when he notices the mirror. Wide-eyed he stares as it begins to heal itself, a webwork of cracks that slowly run together as though the mirror were becoming liquid.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Cypher works with Apoc checking reams of phosphorescent data.  Trinity monitors Neo's electric vital signs. Neo reaches out to touch the mirror and his fingers disappear beneath the rippling surface. Quickly, he tries to pull his fingers out but the mirror stretches in long rubbery strands like mirrored-taffy stuck to his fingertips.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The strands thin like rubber cement as he pulls away, until the fragile wisps of mirror thread break. With the TINKLING of GLASS, shimmering snowflakes of electric-blinking mercury fall, hit the ground, and fade. He looks at his hand; fingers distended into mirrored icicles that begin to melt rapidly, dripping, running like wax down his fingers, spreading across his palms where he sees his face reflected.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morpheus takes out a cellular phone and dials a number.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The mirror gel seems to come to life, racing, crawling up his arns like hundreds of insects.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The mirror creeps up his neck as Neo begins to panic, tipping his head as though he were sinking into the mirror, trying to keep his mouth up.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morpheus is right next to him, with the phone.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Streams of mercury run from Neo's nose.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: An ALARM, on Trinity's monitor ERUPTS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His eyes tear with mirror, rolling up and closing as a high-pitched ELECTRIC SCREAM ERUPTS in the headphones -- It is a piercing SHRIEK like a computer calling to another computer -- Neo's body arches in agony and we are pulled like we were pulled into the holes of the phone Sucked into his SCREAM and swallowed by darkness.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Welcome, Neo.  As you no doubt have guessed, I am Morpheus.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I imagine, right now, you must be feeling a bit like Alice, tumbling down the rabbit hole?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I can see it in your eyes.  You have the look of a man who accepts what he sees because he is expecting to wake up.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Ironically, this is not far from the truth.  But I'm getting ahead of myself.  Can you tell me, Neo, why are you here?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You're Morpheus, you're a legend. Most hackers would die to meet you.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Yes.  Thank you.  But I think we both know there's more to it than that.  Do you believe in fate, Neo?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Because I don't like the idea that I'm not in control of my life.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know exactly what you mean.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Let me tell you why you are here. You are here because you have the gift.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I've watched you, Neo.  You do not use a computer like a tool.  You use it like it was part of yourself.  What you can do inside a computer is not normal.  I know. I've seen it.  What you do is magic.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But it is, Neo.  It is.  How else would you describe what has been happening to you?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We are trained in this world to accept only what is rational and logical.  Have you ever wondered why?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: As children, we do not separate the possible from the impossible which is why the younger a mind is the easier it is to free while a mind like yours can be very difficult.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you want to know what it is, Neo?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It's that feeling you have had all your life.  That feeling that something was wrong with the world.  You don't know what it is but it's there, like a splinter in your mind, driving you mad, driving you to me.  But what is it?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The Matrix is everywhere, it's all around us, here even in this room. You can see it out your window, or on your television.  You feel it when you go to work, or go to church or pay your taxes.  It is the world that has been pulled over your eyes to blind you from the truth.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That you are a slave, Neo.  That you, like everyone else, was born into bondage... ... kept inside a prison that you cannot smell, taste, or touch.  A prison for your mind.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Unfortunately, no one can be told what the Matrix is.  You have to see it for yourself.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This is your last chance.  After this, there is no going back.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You take the blue pill and the story ends.  You wake in your bed and you believe whatever you want to believe.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You take the red pill and you stay in Wonderland and I show you how deep the rabbit-hole goes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Remember that all I am offering is the truth.  Nothing more.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Morpheus, I know what you believe but I think this is a mistake. We're rushing him.  He's old.  I'm afraid he might pop.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Haven't I always told you, Cypher, not to let fear control your life. Apoc, are we on-line?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Apoc?  You wrote the Four Horsemen Virus.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Neo, time is always against us. Will you take a seat there?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I imagine you know sonething about virtual reality.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Essentially, it's a hardware system that uses an apparatus; headgear, gloves and whatever to make you feel that you are in a computer program.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If the virtual reality apparatus, as you called it, was wired to all of your senses and controlled them completely, would you be able to tell the difference between the virtual world and the real world?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The pill you took is part of a trace program.  It's going to make things feel a bit strange.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Tank, we're going to need the signal soon.  Stay calm, Neo.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I knew it, I knew it...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Floating in a womb-red amnion. His body spasms, fighting against the thick gelatin. Metal tubes, surreal versions of hospital tubes, obscure his face.  Other lines like IVs are connected to limbs and cover his genitals. He is struggling desperately now.  Air bubbles into the Jell-O but does not break the surface. Pressing up, the surface distends, stretching like a red rubber coccon. Unable to breathe, he fights wildly to stand, clawing at the thinning elastic shroud -- Until it ruptures, a hole widening around his mouth as he sucks for air.  Tearing himself free, he emerges from the cell. It is Neo. He is bald and naked, his body slick with gelatin. Dizzy, nauseous, he waits for his vision to focus. He is standing in an oval capsule of clear alloy filled with red gelatin, the surface of which has solidified like curdled milk. The IVs in his arms are plugged into outlets that appear to be grafted to his flesh. He feels the weight of another cable and reaches to the back of his head where he finds an enormous coaxial plugged and locked into the base of his skull. He tries to pull it out but it would be easier to pull off a finger. To either side he sees other tube-shaped pods filled with red gelatin; beneath the wax-like surface, pale and motionless, he sees other human beings. Fanning out in a circle, there are more.  All connected to a center core, each capsule like a red, dimly glowing petal attached to a black metal stem. Above him, level after, level, the stem rises seemingly forever.  He moves to the foot of the capsule and looks out. The image assaults his mind. Towers of glowing petals spiral up to incomprehensible heights, disappearing down into a dim murk like an underwater abyss. His sight is blurred and warped, exaggerating the intensity of the vision.  The sound of the PLANT is like the sound of the ocean heard from inside the belly of Leviathan. Below Neo, a petal detaches from the stem, bearing away the body of an old man like an automated barge even as a new pod rises up and plugs itself into the empty space. Inside the new capsule, its surface more translucent and pinkish in color, Neo sees a small baby. From above, a machine drops directly in front of Neo. He swallows his scream as it seems to stare at him. It is almost insect-like in its design; beautiful housings of alloyed metal covering organic-like systems of hard and soft polymers. A black particle beam washes over Neo, he reacts in pain as the scanner seems to expose the nervous system wired to the coaxial cable at his cerebral cortex. At the back of the neck, the cable lock spins and opens, disengaging. The cable pulls itself free, a long clear plastic needle and cerebrum-chip slides from the anterior of Neols skull with an ooze of blood and spinal fluid.  The other connective hoses snap free and snake away as -- The back of the unit opens and a tremendous vacuum, like an airplane door opening, sucks the gelatin and then Neo into a black hole.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The pipe is a waste disposal system and Neo falls, sliding with the clot of gelatin. Banking through pipe spirals and elbows, flushing up through grease traps clogged with cily clunps of cellulite. Neo begins to drown when he is suddenly snatched from the flow of waste. The metallic cable then lifts, pulling him up into the belly of the futuristic flying nachine, hovering inside the sewer main line.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The metal harness opens and drops the half-conscious Neo onto the floor. Human hands and arms help him up as he finds himself looking straight at Morpheus. Trinity and Apoc.  And others, dressed in bizarre, high- tech combat gear. Morpheus smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo passes out.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . We have no sense of time.  We hear VOICES whispering.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Welcome to the real world, Neo.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) Do you think Morpheus is right? Do you think he could be the One?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (O.S.) It doesn't matter now.  But if he's wrong...
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Neo's eyes flutter open.  We see Trinity's face above us, angelic in the fluorescent glow of a light stick.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ... am I dead?
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He opens his eyes again, something tingling through him. He focuses and sees his body pierced with dozens of acupuncture-like needles wired to a strange device.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dozer and Morpheus are operating on Neo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Fluorescent light sticks burn unnaturally bright.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morpheus takes his sunglasses off and puts them on Neo. Neo lays back.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: He needs a lot of work.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Your muscles have atrophied. We're rebuilding them.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Rest, Neo.  The answers are coming.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Neo wakes up from a deep sleep, feeling better.  He is wearing a black tank top and shorts. He begins to examine himself.  There is a futuristic IV plugged into the jack in his forearm.  He pulls it out, staring at the grafted outlet. He feels his bald head.  His fingers find and explore the large outlet in the base of his skull. Just as he starts to come unglued, Morpheus opens the door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The wind is knocked from Neo's chest.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Morpheus, what's happened to me? What is this place?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: More important than what is when?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You believe the year is 1997 when in fact it is much closer to 2197. I can't say for certain what year it is because we honestly do not know.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I promised you the truth, Neo, and the truth is that the world you were living in was a lie.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Like a sleepwalker, Neo follows Morpheus through the ship.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: They climb a ladder up to the main deck.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This is my ship, the Nebuchadnezzar.  It's a hovercraft.  Small like a submarine.  It's dark.  It's cramped and cold.  But it's home.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Everyone is there.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trinity smiles and nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The names and faces wash meaninglessly over Neo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: It is a swamp of bizarre electronic equipment.  Vines of coaxial hang and snake to and from huge monolithic battery slabs, a black portable satellite dish and banks of little systems and computer monitors. At the center of the web, there are six ectoskeleton chairs made of a poly-alloy frame and suspension harness. Near the circle of chairs is the control console and operator's station where the network is monitored.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo allows himself to be helped into one of the chairs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo nods.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He touches Neo's head.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo feels Morpheus guiding a coaxial line into the jack at the back of his neck.  The cable has the same kind of cerebellum chip we saw inside the plant.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There are several disturbing NOISES as he works the needle in. We MOVE IN as Neo's shoulders bunch and his face tightens into a grimace until a loud CLICK fires and his ears pop like when you equalize them underwater. He relaxes, opening his eyes as we pull back to a feeling of weightlessness inside another place -- INT.  CONSTRUCT Neo is standing in an empty, blank-white space.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Startled, Neo whips around and finds Morpheus now in the room with him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morpheus walks past Neo and when Neo turns he sees the two leather chairs from the hotel set up in front of a large-screen television.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo stands at the back of the chair as Morpheus sits.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo's hands run over the cracked leather.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He picks up a remote control and clicks ON the
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This is the main deck.  You know most of my crew.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The ones you don't know.  That's Mouse and Switch.  The two big guys are Tank and Dozer.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And this, this is the Core.  This is where we broadcast our pirate signal and hack into the Matrix.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you remember when I asked you about an apparatus that could turn a virtual reality into reality?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: This will feel a little weird.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It is our loading program.  We can load anything from clothes, to weapons, to training simulations. Anything we need.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Right now, we're inside a computer program?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: What is real?  How do you define real?  If you're talking about your senses, what you feel, taste, smell, or see, then all you're talking about are electrical signals interpreted by your brain.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: .  We drift through the Windy City circa 1996.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We GLIDE AT the television as he changes the channel.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The sky is an endless sea of black and green bile.  The earth, scorched and split like burnt flesh, spreads out beneath us as we ENTER the television.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the distance, we see the ruins of a future Chicago protruding from the wasteland like the blackened ribs of a long-dead corpse.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Still MOVING, we TURN and find Neo and Morpheus; the chairs now sitting in the middle of the black desert. Dizzy, Neo holds onto the chair.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In his sunglasses, we see storm clouds gather.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the circular window of the glasses, EXPLOSIONS light up a bloody battle field.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We MOVE INTO his glasses and the war surrounds us.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: At last we see the Sentinels; killing machines that are at once terrifying and beautiful.  They have an organic architecture like a microbiotic organism, that is perpetually in motion. The Sentinel cracks the body armor of a soldier, splitting open the soft, stearing meat inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The Sentinel locks up, as heat lightning of black ink bursts against the sky, spreading into a permanent cloud of stain.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We return to the power plant that Neo escaped from where we see human beings looking almost blissful in their gelatin cocoons.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Outside, spreading all around the power plant, beneath a breathing greenhouse, are the growing fields.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Huge farm-like reapers are harvesting the crop.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We see inside a clear tubular husk.  Floating in viscous fluid, there is a human fetus; its soft skull already growing around the brain-jack.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We PULL BACK to find the image is now on the television and we are again inside the white space of the Construct.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The room without walls begins to spin.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This is the Chicago you know. Chicago as it was at the end of the twentieth century.  This Chicago exists only as part of a neural-interactive simulation that we call the Matrix.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You have been living inside Baulliaurd's vision, inside the map, not the territory.  This is Chicago as it exists today.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We are, right now, miles below the earth's surface.  The only place humans can survive outside the Matrix is underground.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It started early in the twenty- first century, with the birth of artificial intelligence, a singular consciousness that spawned an entire race of machines.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: At first all they wanted was to be treated as equals, entitled to the same human inalienable rights. Whatever they were given, it was not enough.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We don't know who struck first. Us or them.  But sometime at the end of the twenty-first century the battle was joined.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The war raged for generations and turned the face of our planet from green and blue to black and red.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It scorched and burned the sky. Without the sun, the machines sought out a new energy source to survive.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: They discovered a new form of fusion.  All that was required to initiate the reaction was a small electric charge.  Throughout human history we have been dependent on machines to survive.  Fate, it seems, is not without a sense of irony.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: The human body generates more bio- electricity than a 120-volt battery and over 25,000 B.T.U.'s of body heat.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: We are, as an energy source, easily renewable and completely recyclable, the dead liquified and fed intravenously to the living.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: All they needed to control this new battery was something to occupy our mind.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: And so they built a prison out of our past, wired it to our brains and turned us into slaves.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No!  I don't believe it!  It's not possible!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I didn't say that it would be easy, Neo.  I just said that it would be the truth.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Stop!  Let me out!  I want out!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: His eyes snap open and he thrashes against the chair, trying to rip the cable from the back of his neck.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Dozer holds him while Trinity unlocks it.  Once it's out, he tears away from them, falling as he trips free of the harness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: On his hands and knees, he reels as the world spins. Sweat pours off him as a pressure builds inside his skull as if his brian had been put into a centrifuge.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Vomiting violently, Neo pitches forward and blacks out.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Get this thing out of me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't touch me!  Get away from me!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He blinks, regaining consciousness.  The room is dark. Neo is stretched out on his bed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morpheus sitting like a shadow on a chair in the far corner.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo isn't sure of that answer.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He stares into the darkness, confessing as much to himself as Neo.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He pauses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo can feel his eyes on him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morpheus smiles, leaning towards hin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He stands up.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I can't go back, can I?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: No.  But if you could, would you really want to?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I feel that I owe you an apology. There is a rule that we do not free a mind once it reaches a certain age.  It is dangerous. They have trouble letting go.. Their mind turns against them. I've seen it happen.  I broke the rule because I had to.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When the Matrix was first built there was a man born inside that had the ability to change what he wanted, to remake the Matrix as he saw fit.  It was this man that freed the first of us and taught us the secret of the war; control the Matrix and you control the future.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: When he died, the Oracle at the temple of Zion prophesied his return and envisioned an end to the war and freedom for our people.  That is why there are those of us that have spent our entire lives searching the Matrix, looking for him.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I did what I did, because I believe we have been brought here for a reason, Neo.  You are here to serve a purpose, just as I am here to serve mine.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I told you I don't believe in fate.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: But I do, Neo.  I do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Get some rest.  You're going to need it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: There is no morning; there is only darkness and then the fluorescent light sticks flicker on.

direction.raw_text: Neo is awake in his bed, staring up at the lights.  The door opens and TA.NK steps inside.

direction.raw_text: He offers his hand and Neo shakes it.  He notices that Tank doesn't have any jacks.

direction.raw_text: Tank smiles.

dialogue.raw_text: You will tonight.  I guarantee it. I'm Tank.  I'll be your operator.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Any holes?  Nope.  Me and my brother Dozer, we are 100 percent pure, old fashioned, home-grown human.  Born free.  Right here in the real world.  Genuine child of Zion.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Zion is the place, man.  You'll see it one day.  Last human city. All we got left.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Goddamn, I got to tell you I'm fairly excited to see what you are capable of.  I mean if Morpheus is right and all.  We're not supposed to talk.about any of that, but if you are, well then this is an exciting time.  We got a lot to do so let's get to it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: He assumes a fighting stance.

direction.raw_text: Neo assumes a similar stance, cautiously circling until he gives a short cry and launches a furious attack. It is like a Jackie Chan movie at high speed, fists and feet striking from every angle as Neo presses his attack
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: This is a sparring program, similar to the programmed reality of the Matrix.  Consider this your first lesson.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: But each and every blow is blocked by effortless speed.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: While their minds battle in the programmed reality, the two bodies appear quite serene, suspended in the drive chairs. Tank monitors their life systems noticing that Neo is wildly and chaotically lit up as opposed to the slow and steady rhythm of Morpheus.

direction.raw_text: Dinner is up.  Everyone is eating bowls of single-cell protein.  It has a cottage cheese consistency.

direction.raw_text: bursts in the room.

direction.raw_text: Morpheus attacks him and it is like nothing we have seen. His feet and fists are everywhere taking Neo apart.  For every blow Neo blocks, five more hit their marks until -- Neo falls. Panting, on his hands and knees, blood spits fror, his mouth speckling the white floor of the Dojo.

direction.raw_text: Neo is frustrated, still unable to catch his breath.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo squints at him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo stands, nodding.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Their fists fly with  pneumatic speed.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Good.  Adaption.  Improvisation. But your weakness isn't your technique.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you think my being faster, stronger has anything to do with my muscles in this place?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Do you believe that's air you are breathing now?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: If you can free your mind, the body will follow.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Everyone is gathered behind Tank, watching the fight, like watching a game of Mortal Combat.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Jeezus Keerist!  That boy is fast!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You ever seen anyone that fast that soon, Tank?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Morpheus is right.  He's got to be the one.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The speed of the blows rises like a drum solo that seems impossible to sustain.  Neo's face sheds its mask of calm with a scream. He wants to beat Morpheus bad. Finally a single blow catches Morpheus on the side of the head, knocking his glasses off.

direction.raw_text: There are several gasps.

direction.raw_text: Neo pants.

dialogue.raw_text: Good, good.  Anger is a gift, Neo, but it's a heavy one.

dialogue.raw_text: You have to learn to let go of that anger.  You must let go of everything.

direction.raw_text: whipping Morpheus' long coat to the side.

direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: But comes up drastically short. His eyes widen as he plummets.  Stories fly by, the ground rushing up at him, but as he hits -- The ground gives way, stretchinp like a trapeze net. He bounces and flips, slowly coming to a rest, flat on his back. He laughs, a bit unsure, wiping the wind-blown tears from his face. Morpheus exits the building and helps him to his feet.

direction.raw_text: Neo nods quietly.

She pauses, her face close to his, then inhales lightly, breathing in the scent of him, before slowly pulling away. It seems the moment she closes the door, he wakes with a start, unsure of where he is.  After a moment, he gets out of bed.

dialogue.raw_text: Good shit, huh?  Dozer makes it. It's good for two things: degreasing engines and killing brain cells.

dialogue.raw_text: Let me give you a piece of advice. Between you and me, if Morpheus says you can fly, I wouldn't go jumping out any windows to find out if he's right.  Understand?

dialogue.raw_text: You know, I know that this steak doesn't exist.  I know when I put it in my mouth, the Matrix is telling my brain that it is juicy and delicious.  After nine years, do you know what I've realized?

dialogue.raw_text: I don't want to remember nothing. Nothing!  You understand?  And I want to be rich.  Someone important.  Like an actor.  You can do that, right?

dialogue.raw_text: All right.  You get my body back in a power plant, reinsert me into the Matrix and I'll get you what you want.

Some are playing, others meditating or practicing their gift. Neo watches a little girl levitate wooden alphabet blocks.  A skinny BOY holds a SPOON which sways like a blade of grass as he bends it with his rnind. Neo crosses to him, sits. The Boy smiles as Neo picks up a spoon and tries to imitate him.  Despite his best efforts, Neo cannot make it bend.

dialogue.raw_text: You know, for a long time, I thought I was in love with you, Trinity.  I used to dream about you...
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You are a beautiful woman.  Too bad things had to work out like this.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: In a way you're very lucky.  Most people never know why they die. One minute they're alive, the next they're dead.  No warning. Nothing.  That's why I thought maybe I should tell you.  It seemed the least I could do.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: You see, the truth, the real,truth is that the war is over.  It's been over for a long time.  And guess what?  We lost!  Did you hear that?  We lost the war!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Zion?  Zion is a part of this delusion.  More of this madness. That's why this has to be done. It has to end.  Now and forever.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh rny God.  This is abzut Zion. You gave them Morpheus for the access codes to Zion.

dialogue.raw_text: You see, Trinity, we humans have a place in the future.  But it's not here.  It's in the Matrix.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Oh, I disagree, Trinity.  I disagree.  I think the Matrix is more real than this world.  I mean, all I do is pull a plug here.  But there, you watch a man die.

dialogue.raw_text: You tell me which is more real.

dialogue.raw_text: Somehow, some way, you're going to pay for this.

dialogue.raw_text: Don't hate me, Trinity.  I'm just the messenger.  And right now I'm going to prove that the message is true.

direction.raw_text: moving at impossible speed. For a blinking noment we enter BULLET-TIME. Gun flash tongues curl from Neols gun, bullets float forward like a plane noving across the sky, cartridges cartwheel into space. An instant later they are nearly on top of each other, rolling up out of a move that is almost a mirrored reflection of the other -- Each jamming their gun tight to the other's head. They freeze in a kind of embrace; Neo sweating, panting, Agent Smith machine-calm. Agent Smith smiles.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo pulls the TRIGGER.  CLICK.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The smile falls.  Agent Smith yanks his TRIGGER.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: . Agent Smith's face warps with rage and he attacks, fist flying at furious speed, blows and counters, Neo retreating as -- A knife-hand opens his forearm, and a kick sends him slamming back against a steel column. Stunned, he ducks just under a punch that crunches into the beam, STEEL CHUNKS EXPLODING like shrapnel. Behind him, Neo leaps into the air, delivering a neck- snapping reverse round-house.  Agent Smith's glasses fly off and he glares at Neo; his eyes, ice blue.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He attacks with a vicious series of blows but the Agent seems to absorb them, waiting for his opening. And this time Agent Smith's attack is too much, an unrelenting fury, fists pounding like jackhammers.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trinity watches Neo as his body jerks, mouth coughing blood, his life signs going wild.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agent Smith grabs hold of him, lifting him into the air, hurling him against the curved wall of the train tunnel, where he falls inches from the electrified third-rail. The Agent is about to jump down, and press his attack when he hears sonething.  From deep in the tunnel, like an animal cry; a burst of high-speed METAL GRINDING against METAL. The sound of an ON-COMING TRAIN.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tank is trying to find another entrance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: From the cockpit, an ALARM sounds.  Morpheus hurries to the front console, typing, bringing up the radar. Trinity follows him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In every pipe surrounding them, they see the Extermination Unit.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The killing machine we saw in the History Program blister by us like tracer bullets shot down the throat of the abyss.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo tries to get up.  Agent Smith jumps down onto the tracks and drop-kicks him in the face. The world begins to shake, RUMBLING as the TRAIN NEARS.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agent Smith grabs Neo in a choke-hold, forcing him to look down the tracks, the train's headlight burning a hole in the darkness.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo sees it coming and he starts to fight.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is another METAL SCREECH, MUCH LOUDER, closer, as Agent Smith tightens his hold.  Neo is unable to breathe.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The TRAIN ROARS at them, swallowing Agent Smith's words. The veins bulge in Neo's head, as he grits through the pain. He is not ready to die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Impossibly, he hurls himself straight up, smashing Smith against the concrete ceiling of the tunnel. They fall as the sound and fury of the TRAIN EXPLODES INTO the station. Neo back-flips up off the tracks just as -- The train barrels over Agent Smith. Neo stands, knees shaking, when the train slams on its emergency brake.  With an ear-splitting SHRIEK of
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Do you hear that, Mr. Anderson?
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: That is the sound of inevitability.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: It is the sound of your death.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: the train slows, part of it still in the station. Neo turns, limping, starting to run, racing for the escalator -- As the train comes to a stop and the doors of the last car open; Agent Smith bursts out in furious pursuit, his glasses again intact.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morpheus checks the ship's self destruct key.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You can't use that until Neo is out!
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: I know.  Don't worry, he'll make it.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: A man sits in his Mercedes, talking on his car phone when his door is thrown open.  Neo yanks him out and jumps in. Further down the street, Agent Smith slows, calmly touching his ear-piece. Neo throws the car across traffic, rocketing down a side- street.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Driving like a demon with one hand, he grabs the car phone and dials long distance.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Tank answers.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Mr. Wizard, Get me the fuck out of here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Looking over his shoulder, watching the mirrors, Neo drives almost unconsciously.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Hurry, Tank!  I got some serious pursuit!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The keyboard clicking, Tank searches for an exit. Trinity screams into the headset.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Neo, you better get your ass back here!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: m trying, Trinity.  I'm trying.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo glances to his right and sees Agent Brown, now driving the car beside his.  Agent Brown swerves, slamming into him.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo fights the steering wheel as Agent Brown pushes the car up over the median.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo drops the phone as his car bucks into the opposing lane -- Directly into the charging path of an enormous truck driven by Agent Smith. Neo dives from the Mercedes as the truck plows into it, rending metal and GLASS, crushing through, totaling other cars, as it EXPLODES. Neo is up and running even as orange and black clouds billow up behind hin.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three figures silhouette by the burning wreckage become the three agents. Further down the street, Neo hauls his broken, bleeding ass. Agents Brown and Smith slow, touching their ear-pieces as Agent Jones continues chasing full-bore. Neo spins around a corner, racing toward a hotel called: the Heart of Chicago Hotel. Only Agent Jones is behind him now. Neo dives into the alley.  At the far end he sees Agent Brown charging.  Neo leaps for the fire escape and begins to climb.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Sentinels open and shift like killer kaleidoscopes as they ready their weapons, swarming around the Nebuchadnezzar.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The hovercraft booms as machines drop onto it.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I'm going to make the call.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Agent Snith is in the elevator when he hears the DISTANT RING of a PHONE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: The agents chase him, FIRING, BULLETS SPARKING and
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: even as Neo jumps for the third-floor platform. Neo kicks in the window, jumping into the hall.  The doors count backwards:  310...  309...
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morpheus grabs the biggest gun he can find.  The lasers begin to slice through the hull.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo can hear the PHONE RINGING.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: ...  304... Agent Brown reaches the broken window behind him just as Neo grabs the handle of 303, throwing open the door to find -- Agent Sniith, waiting, .45 cocked. Neo can't move -- can't think -- BOOM.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo's body jerks, and everyone hears it as the life monitors snap flat-line. Trinity screams.  Morpheus is frozen in disbelief.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Three holes in his chest, Neo falls to the blue shag carpeting, blood smearing down the wallpaper. Agent Smith stands over him, still aiming, taking no chances.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Through the lasered opening, Morpheus screams, blasting away at the machines; comet-wads of plasma burning holes in their armored housings. Trinity collapses onto Neo's body.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: No-no-no!  Neo, you're not dead! You can't be dead!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Kneeling beside him, Agent Brown checks his vital signs.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agent Smith smiles, standing over him.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: I told you, you couldn't win.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: Tank is hit, a laser bolt knocking him to the ground. They can't hold them off any longer.  Morpheus lunges for the self destruct -- As Trinity whispers in Neo's ear.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: You're right here.  I'm holding you, Neo.  I'm not letting you go. Do you hear me?  I won't let you go.
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The agents walk to the elevator, leaving Neo's body behind.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Morpheus flicks the Plexiglas shield of the self- destruct.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: She pounds on his chest.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: Goddamnit, Neo!  Don't give it up! Not now!
dialogue.name: dialogue

direction.raw_text: The BLOW ECHOES deep in his mind. His eyes snap open.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Trinity screams as the monitors jump back to life.  Tank and Morpheus stare, unbelieving. It is a miracle.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo struggles, holding his chest, sitting up.  Down the hall, he sees the elevator closing and -- Agent Smith staring at him as if he were looking at a Cypher. Neo gives him the finger.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Agent Smith pounds on the elevator door.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A sentinel BLOWS a hole in Morpheus' right arm and he screams, refusing to let go of the detonator.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Neo dives for the RINGING PHONE.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: Machines split open the craft, pouring in, lasers targeting everywhere. A beat finds the center of Morpheus' forehead and he screams, ready to die.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: He turns the key.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: A blinding shock of white lights flood the chamber; sentinels blink and fall instantly dead, filling the pit with their cold, metal carcasses.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: In the still darkness, only the humans are alive.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: His eyes open.  Tears pour from her smiling eyes as he reaches up to touch her. And she kisses hin; it seems like it might last forever.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: as in the opening.  The cursor beating steadily, waiting.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: begins to RING. It is answered and the screen fills instantly with the trace program.  After a long beat, we recognize Neo's voice.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We CLOSE IN ON the racing columns of numbers shimmering across the screen.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We DIVE THROUGH the numbers, surging UP THROUGH the darkness, sucked TOWARDS a tight constellation of stars.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We realize that the constellation is actually the holes in the mouthpiece of a phone.  Seen from inside.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: We SHOOT THROUGH the holes as Neo hangs up the phone. He steps out of the phone booth and starts walking, wearing a long black coat and dark glasses.  He passes a mother dragging her little BOY, who cranes his neck as -- Neo takes off, flying up into the air.
direction.name: direction

direction.raw_text: There is a RUSH of AIR as the Boy stares up as Neo shoots overhead.  His coat billowing like a black leather cape as he soars up, up, and away.
direction.name: direction

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) Hi.  It's me.  I know you're out there.  I know you're working as fast as you can to catch me.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I thought I should call and let you know how things stand.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I know you're real proud of this world you've built, the way it works, all the nice little rules and such, but I've got some bad news.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: (V.O.) I've decided to make a few changes.
dialogue.name: dialogue

dialogue.raw_text: Don't be silly, honey.  Men don't fly.
dialogue.name: dialogue
